issue.title: [C++] Use ArrayData instead of Array for ArrayData::dictionary
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6856](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6856). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This would be helpful for consistency. `DictionaryArray` may want to cache a "boxed" version of this to return from `DictionaryArray::dictionary`

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6856?focusedCommentId=17040057) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Should we do this before 1.0?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6856?focusedCommentId=17116211) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Yes. I just added to the milestone

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6856?focusedCommentId=17123996) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I did this in https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/94a5026edb652d060110cac170380edf3d856f05
